feed.title: Less is better: I want to go full screen
feed.subtitle: John Lam on software

entry.title: I want to go full screen
entry.summary:
I just tried out WriteRoom, which is a full-screen text editor. There was something incredibly therapeutic about the experience. There were no distractions at all, and I could make-believe that this was the only application that my computer could run.

Now if only I could go full-screen with emacs and do away with the status bar…

entry.title: Comment on I want to go full screen by madh
entry.content:
I was a little surprised that ESC didn't get me out of fullscreen. But then I moved my mouse to the top and got the expected menu bar with the option and shortcut keys to get back out of fullscreen mode.

I like it.

entry.title: Comment on I want to go full screen by RichB
entry.content: God forbid you install it and immediate click the + icon. There's no obvious way to get out of the full-screenness. Luckily , I know about Apple-Q.
